PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Boden Klein & Sneesby A Professional Corp

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF THE DEAF IS TO PRESERVE, PROTECT AND PROMOTE THE CIVIL, HUMAN AND LINGUISTIC RIGHTS OF DEAF, DEAFBLIND, DEAFDISABLED, HARD OF HEARING, AND LATE-DEAFENED PEOPLE IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF THE DEAF IS TO PRESERVE, PROTECT AND PROMOTE THE CIVIL, HUMAN AND LINGUISTIC RIGHTS OF DEAF, DEAFBLIND, DEAFDISABLED, HARD OF HEARING, AND LATE-DEAFENED PEOPLE IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
IRS990.Desc: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT- DESCRIBED AND CAPTIONED MEDIA PROGRAM (DCMP) - SOLICITED, SCREENED, EVALUATED, PROCURED, DESCRIBED, CAPTIONED AND DISTRIBUTED K-12 EDUCATIONAL MEDIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONFERENCES - BIENNIAL NAD CONFERENCES ARE HELD IN THE SUMMER/FALL OF EVEN NUMBERED YEARS AND TRADITIONALLY BRINGS TOGETHER MORE THAN 2,000 DEAF, HARD OF HEARING, LATE- DEAFENED, DEAF- BLIND AND HEARING CONSUMERS, PARENTS, YOUTH, PROFESSIONALS, EDUCATORS AND ORGANIZATIONAL AND CORPORATE REPRESENTATIVES FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPEMENT, ENRICHMENT, TRAINING, NETWORKING, GOVERNANCE MEETINGS, EXHIBITS, RECEPTIONS AND RELATED EVENTS. IN ODD NUMBERED YEARS, THE NAD HOSTS THE NAD LEADERSHIP TRAINING CONFERENCE (NLTC) WHICH DRAWS APPROXIMATELY 150- 200 DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING INDIVIDUALS FOR TRAINING ON NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONAL AND BOARD OPERATION, LEGISLATIVE ADVOCACY, AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: LAW AND ADVOCACY CENTER- COORDINATED EFFORTS FOCUSING ON ACCESSIBILITY AND CIVIL RIGHTS ISSUES AFFECTING DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING PEOPLE IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TREE OF LIFE ENDOWMENT FUND - $145,251 ESTABLISHED IN 1997:INTENDED USE - TO RAISE FUNDS FOR MULTIPUPOSE RETREAT/ TRAINING FACILITY; YOUTH LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS; STATE ASSOCIATION TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND TO SUPPORT PARENT- CONSUMER PARTNERSHIP EFFORTS.MOTOR CITY ASSOCIATION OF THE DEAF (MDA) ENDOWNMENT FUND- $145,322 ESTABLISHED IN 1995. INTENDED USE: TO SUPPORT MDA THROUGH COVERAGE OF ADVOCACY RIGHTS RELATED TRAINING EXPENSES (TRAVEL AND HONORARIUM) OF UP TO $3,000/YEAR, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STIPULATIONS.
MANAGEMENT HAS CONSIDERED ALL ITS TAX POSITIONS AND BELIEVES THAT ALL OF THE POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ORGANIZATION ON ITS TAX FILINGS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: PERIODICALS/ MARKETING- DISTRIBUTED INFORMATION ABOUT NAD ADVOCACY ACTIVITIES VIA OUR WEBSITE AND THE NAD MAGAZINE WHICH IS TITLED NADMAG AND IS A GLOSSY, FULL COLOR, BI-ANNUAL PUBLICATION. THE NADMAG IS A MEMBERSHIP BENEFIT AND IS ALSO AVAIALABLE VIA SUBSCRIPTION FOR LIBRARIES AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: JUNIOR NAD IS A PROGRAM FOUNDED AND OPERATED BY THE NAD TO PROMOTE YOUTH LEADERSHIP BY ALLOWING DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS TO DETERMINE THEIR OWN ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS. THIS PROGRAM DEVELOPS INTEREST AND LEADERSHIP AMONG THESE YOUNG DEAF STUDENTS IN STATE ASSOCIATIONS, SCHOOLS, AND/OR ORGANIZATIONS OF THE DEAF. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: CONFERENCES - BIENNIAL NAD CONFERENCES ARE HELD IN THE SUMMER/FALL OF EVEN NUMBERED YEARS AND TRADITIONALLY BRINGS TOGETHER MORE THAN 2,000 DEAF, HARD OF HEARING, LATE- DEAFENED, DEAF- BLIND AND HEARING CONSUMERS, PARENTS, YOUTH, PROFESSIONALS, EDUCATORS AND ORGANIZATIONAL AND CORPORATE REPRESENTATIVES FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPEMENT, ENRICHMENT, TRAINING, NETWORKING, GOVERNANCE MEETINGS, EXHIBITS, RECEPTIONS AND RELATED EVENTS. IN ODD NUMBERED YEARS, THE NAD HOSTS THE NAD LEADERSHIP TRAINING CONFERENCE (NLTC) WHICH DRAWS APPROXIMATELY 150- 200 DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING INDIVIDUALS FOR TRAINING ON NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONAL AND BOARD OPERATION, LEGISLATIVE ADVOCACY, AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 7: THE NAD YOUTH PITCH CONTEST - IS A COMPETITION FOR DEAF, DEAFBLIND, DEAFDISABLED, AND HARD OF HEARING YOUTH AGES 18 TO 30 WITHIN THE DEAF COMMUNITY CURRENTLY RESIDING IN THE UNITED STATES. CONTESTANTS WILL COMPETE AGAINST EACH OTHER TO DETERMINE WHO HAS THE BEST IDEA FOR A BUSINESS, A PRODUCT, SOCIAL CHANGE, OR OTHER PROPOSAL. THE GOAL OF THIS CONTEST IS TO HIGHLIGHT AND SUPPORT THESE YOUTH WITH THEIR IDEAS TO CHANGE THE WORLD. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 8: MEMBERSHIP - THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF THE DEAF (NAD) RECEIVES DUES FROM MEMBERS WHO JOIN TO BE PART OF THE NATION'S PREMIER CIVIL RIGHTS ORGANIZATION OF, BY AND FOR DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. INDIVIDUAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL MEMBERSHIP MAKES IT POSSIBLE FOR THE NAD TO PROTECT THE COLLECTIVE INTERESTS OF THE AMERICAN DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING COMMUNITY THROUGH ADVOCACY EFFORTS WITH OUR NATION'S POLICY MAKERS AND OPINION LEADERS AT THE FEDRAL LEVEL, WITH AMERICAN SIGN LANGUAUGE AS A CORE VALUE. MEMBERSHIP ALSO SUPPORTS THE NAD AS UNITED STATES AFFILIATE TO THE WORLD FEDERATION OF THE DEAF IN THE ADAVANCEMENT OF INTERNATIONAL HUMAN, CIVIL AND LINGUISTIC RIGHTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS (INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZTIONAL) CAN VOTE AT BIENNIAL NATIONAL CONFERENCES IN THE GENERAL FORUM ON PRIORITIES PROPOSED IN ADVANCE BY MEMBERSHIP. THE TOP RANKED 10 PRIORITIES THEN TO GO THE COUNCIL OF REPRESENTATIVES (DELEGATE ASSEMBLY, COMPRISED BY DELEGATES STIPULATED BY BYLAWS TO REPRESENT GROUPS/CLASSES OF INDIVIDUAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL MEMBERSHIP) FOR VOTE ON THE TOP 5 TO BE SENT TO THE BOARD FOR FURTHER ACTION DURING THE NEW TERM. COUNCIL OF REPRESENTATIVES DELEGATES ALSO VOTE ON BYLAWS AMENDMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CEO AND DIRECTOR OF FINANCE BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT AT EACH QUARTERLY BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION FOR STAFF POSITIONS IS DETERMINED BY MANAGEMENT AFTER REVIEW OF LOCAL, REGIONAL AND NATIONAL NONPROFIT DATA (IN LINE WITH POSITION REQUIREMENTS AND COMMENSURATE SALARY RANGES).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
